meanings.definition: Scatter in small drops or particles
meanings.sent1: She likes to sprinkle sugar on her cereal every morning.
meanings.sent2: The chef will sprinkle some herbs on top of the dish before serving.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to sprinkle fairy dust on her toys.
meanings.sent4: The stars sprinkle the night sky like diamonds on black velvet.
meanings.sent5: The gentle rain continued to sprinkle the garden with much-needed water.

meanings.definition: A small quantity or number scattered or sprinkled
meanings.sent1: A sprinkle of cinnamon added a nice touch to the dessert.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecast predicted a sprinkle of rain in the afternoon.
meanings.sent3: The sprinkle of confetti made the party decorations festive.
meanings.sent4: She noticed a sprinkle of glitter on her desk, evidence of a craft project.
meanings.sent5: The sprinkle of laughter in the room lifted everyone's spirits.
